markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) NORTH OF THE FREDERIKSTED MUNICIPAL PIER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE FREDERIKSTED MUNICIPAL PIER GO EAST FOR 1 BLOCK TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH FOR 0.5 KM (0.25 MI) TO A BALL PARK DIAMOND ON RIGHT AND STATION ON LEFT AT END OF PUBLIC BEACH.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---PEIRCE AZ 2 1980---, CEMENTED IN A MASS OF CONCRETE IN A ROCK POCKET, FLUSH. IT IS LOCATED 25.5 METERS (83.7 FT) SOUTH FROM THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF A CONCRETE ROAD THAT LEADS TO EDGE OF WATER, 13.3 METERS (43.6 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF AN OLD STONE CIRCULAR FIREPLACE AND 3.4 METERS (11.2 FT) EAST FROM WATERS EDGE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.5 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE HILL BACK OF THE LONG PROMINENT POINT BETWEEN TURNERS HOLE AND ROD BAY S SIDE, E END OF ST. CROIX.  THE STATION IS NOT ON THE BLUFF OR SMALL HILL FORMING THE POINT BUT ON THE HIGHER HILL N OF THE ROAD.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN LOW OUTCROPPING ROCK ON THE S SIDE OF THE TOP OF THE HILL.  IT SEES THE SIGNAL PLACED ON THE POINT S OF IT.  TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE PLACED BUT THEIR DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM THE STATION MARK WAS LEFT TO BE MEASURED WHEN THE STATION SHOULD BE OCCUPIED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1921)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1921 (ERH) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED, AND IS OCCUPIED.  ONLY ONE REFERENCE MARK WAS FOUND.  IT IS NE OF STATION, DISTANT 10.84 METERS AND IS 336 DEG FROM GOAT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1919.  ONLY ONE REFERENCE MARK WAS FOUND, ABOUT 35 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE STATION, AS PER THE 1921 RECOVERY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE DOCK AREA IN CHRISTIANSTED, FOLLOW THE MAIN ROAD EAST FOR 1.25 MILES TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT ON WINDING PAVED ROAD AND CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY FOR 1.75 MILES TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY FOR 1.75 MILES TO A THREE-WAY INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND FOLLOW PAVED ROAD SOUTHERLY FOR 3.85 MILES, JUST PAST THE SHARP TURN AT GRASS PT.  PACK UPHILL AND WESTERLY FROM HERE TO TOP OF BLUFF, THEN NORTHERLY TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION.  ABOUT A 10 MINUTE PACK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 6.5 MI. EAST OF CHRISTIANSTED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS ON TOP OF THE FIRST HILL NORTH OF GRASS POINT.  THIS HILL IS COVERED WITH LOW GRASS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. TO REACH FROM THE GRAPETREE BEACH HOTEL ON THE WEST SIDE OF GRAPETREE BAY, GO SOUTH WEST ON MAIN ROAD FOR 1.0 KM (0.6 MI)TO A SHARP CURVE AND ETT. PACK NORTH UPHILL FOR APPROXIMATELY 20 MINUTES TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION IN WAIST HIGH GRASS.
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON GRASS POINT ON THE WEST SIDE OF GRAPETREE BAY. ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF ST CROIX.  TO REACH FROM THE GRAPETREE BEACH HOTEL ON THE WEST SO SIDE OF GRAPETREE BAY GO SOUTHWEST FOR 1.0 KM (0.6 MI) TO A SHARP CURVE,ETT FOR STATION PENTHANY, CONTINUE AROUND CURVE FOR 0.3 KM (0.2 MI) TO A REVERSE FORK LEFT. TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION.  THE STATION IS A NOS BRASS DISK STAMPED---PENTHENY AZ MK---, CEMENTED IN CONCRETE IN SOLID ROCK.  IT IS LOCATED, 7.0 METERS (23.0 FT) NORTH FROM SOUTH EDGE OF CLIFF, 14.0 METERS (46.0 FT ) WEST FROM EAST EDGE OF CLIFF 28.0 METERS (92.0 FT) EAST FROM WEST EDGE OF CLIFF.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.6 METERS. DESCRIBED BY MWJ.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS ON FLAT WESTERN PART OF PERKINS CAY.  PERKINS CAY IS OFF THE POINT SEPARATING DENIS BAY FROM HOGNEST BAY ON THE WESTERN END, NORTHERN SIDE OF ST. JOHN.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED INTO THE ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2006 (RBP) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NW OF STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED. HEAVY PATINA, BUT READABLE.  REACHABLE BY DINGHY.  ROCKY TERRAIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (2016)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2016 (OKC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED BUT WILL PROBABLY NOT BE VISABLE FROM SEAWARD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE OLD MILL STILL EXISTS BUT HAS NO ROOF OR DEFINITE CENTER POINT.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS IN THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND AT THE EAST SIDE OF THE ENTRANCE OF ST THOMAS HARBOR AT THE NORTH SIDE OF MUHLENFELS POINT NEAR THE SHORE END OF OF A BACKFILLED WHARF AT FRENCHMENS REEF RESORT.  TO REACH FROM CHARLOTTE AMALIE, GO EAST ON HWY 30 OUT OF TOWN PAST THE WEST INDIAN COMPANY AND UP LISENLUND HILL TO A POINT WHERE HWY 30 TURNS TO THE LEFT, FROM THIS POINT CONTINUE STRAIGHT ON ROUTE 315 DOWN THE HILL AND THEN UP ANOTHER TO THE FRENCHMANS REEF RESORT ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT INTO THE MAIN ENTRANCE AND IMMEDIATELY BEAR RIGHT ON A DRIVE WHICH TUNNELS UNDER A BUILDING AND CONTINUE DOWNHILL TO A DIVE SHOP, A CONCRETE PARKING SLAB AND THE STATION.  THE STATION IS A STEEL PIPE SET IN CONCRETE (THE PIPE IS 5 CM IN DIAMETER AND IS THE SHEARED OFF REMAINS OF FORMER FENCE OR GATE POST) AT AN ANGLE WHICH IS FORMED BETWEEN THE CONCRETE PARKING SLAB AND A SIDEWALK WHICH LEADS ONTO THE WHARF.

markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE N SIDE OF ST. THOMAS ISLAND, AND ON THE NE SHORE OF MAGENS BAY.  IT IS NEAR THE OUTERMOST END OF PICARA POINT.  A BOLD, ROCKY POINT.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE FLAT TOP OF A ROCK.  IT IS ABOUT 24 FEET ABOVE THE WATER LINE.  DUTCHMANS CAP AND COCKROACH ISLAND JUST SHOW BETWEEN OUTER AND INNER BRASS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS SITUATED ON THE TOP OF MT. PLEASANT.  MT. PLEASANT IS THE PROMINENT HILL RISING N OF HERMITAGE ESTATE HOUSE AND LIES DUE N OF THE MIDDLE OF THE ENTRANCE TO HURRICANE HOLO.  THE MOST EASTERLY HILL ON NORMAN ISLAND, AND THE TANGENT OF THE N SHORE OF EAST END, ST. JOHN ISLAND ARE ON RANGE.  A POINT OF BUCK ISLAND 15 METERS W OF THE EASTERN TANGENT OF THE ISLAND AND THE W TANGENT OF TURNERS POINT ARE ON RANGE.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN A 0.3-METER DIAMETER BOULDER BURIED FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE RIDGE AT ITS HIGHEST POINT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED INTO THE TOP OF A ROCK PROJECTING 0.4 METER.  THE ROCK IS 0.3 BY 0.5 METER.  IT LIES 5 FEET BELOW THE TOP OF THE HILL AND ON THE WESTERN SIDE ABOUT THE MIDDLE OF THE RIDGE.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS A REGULAR BRASS DISK ON SMOOTH BOULDERY POINT, BELOW MT. PLEASANT, A SMOOTH LINE OF BOULDERS AND ROCKS RUNS UP THE HILL, HERE SEPARATING THE SANDY BEACH FROM THE BOULDERS ON THE E.  THIS IS AN INTERSECTION STATION.  ELEVATION ABOUT 7 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE NORTHERNMOST POINT OF BOTANY BAY, W SHORE OF ST. THOMAS.  THIS POINT IS CALLED TARGET POINT.  THE ROCKY POINT RISES VERY ABRUPTLY OUT OF THE WATER TO A HEIGHT OF ABOUT 20 FEET.  SAIL ROCK IS ON RANGE WITH THE WESTERNMOST POINT OF THE ISLAND.  STUMPY POINT IS ON RANGE WITH THE FIRST PROMINENT POINT TO THE EASTWARD OF THE STATION.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION MARK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROCK.  THE DISK IS SURROUNDED BY A TRIANGLE CUT IN THE ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE MARK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE TO THE SOUTHWARD.  IT IS 14.8 METERS (INCLINED) S 70 DEG E MAGNETIC FROM STATION.  CRICKET ROCK BEARS N 14 DEG W MAGNETIC FROM THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION FOUND EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED.  RE-NAMED IN HYDROGRAPHY TARG.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (JKW) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED ON PAGE 1 PAMPHLET 624.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--6 MILES WEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE END OF THE CHRISTIANSTED MUNICIPAL PORT AUTHORITY PIER.  THE STATION IS A NOS BRASS DISK STAMPED---PORT 81---, CEMENTED IN A DRAINAGE HOLE.  THE STATION WAS OCCUPIED ECCENTRICALLY.  IT IS LOCATED , ON CENTERLINE OF THE PIER, 1 0.9 METERS (3.9 FT) NORTH FROM THE END OF THE PIER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.6 METERS. DESCRIBED BY MWJ.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN A MAT FOUNDATION OR CONCRETE SLAB OTHER THAN
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF MAIN CLIFF OF PRIVATEER POINT, ON THE E END OF ST. JOHN ISLAND.  TO THE E OF THE STATION THE CLIFF FALLS AWAY SHEER TO THE ROCKY SHORELINE, AND TO THE W IT SLOPES STEEPLY.  TO THE SOUTHWARD THE CLIFF FALLS AWAY ABRUPTLY TO A NECK OF BROKEN ROCK AWASH, WHICH JOINS THE MAIN CLIFF TO A DETACHED PORTION OF CLIFF RUNNING OUT ABOUT 50 METERS.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A DEPRESSION OF THE CLIFF.                            STATION RECOVERY (1924)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (GCM) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1957 STATION MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED.  THIS MARK WAS SITUATED ON A RAZOR-BACK RIDGE WHICH IS BREAKING UP DUE TO THE WEATHERING ACTION OF WIND AND WAVES.  A LARGE PORTION OF THE TIP OF THE RIDGE HAS BROKEN OFF AND FALLEN INTO THE BREAKERS AT THE BASE OF THE CLIFF, WHICH IS BELIEVED TO CONTAIN THE DISK.  THE REMAINING PORTIONS OF THE RIDGE ARE VERY UNSTABLE AS THEY COULD BE SHAKEN WITH A SHORT KICK.  THE PORTION WHICH WAS BROKEN OFF COULD NOT BE INSPECTED BECAUSE OF ITS INACESSIBILITY.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (PDC) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE OUTER END OF A LONG PROMONTORY FORMING THE EASTERNMOST POINT OF SANTA MARIA BAY, N SHORE OF ST. THOMAS.  THIS POINT IS ONE OF THE MOST PROMINENT POINTS ON THE N SHORE OF THE ISLAND.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 10 METERS NW OF THE HIGHEST PART OF THE PROMONTORY.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION MARK CEMENTED IN A HOLE IN THE ROCK.  STATION IS ON RANGE WITH HIGHEST POINT OF OUTER BRASS ISLAND, AND STUMPY POINT.  LIZARD ROCK LIES N 50 DEG E MAGNETIC AND CRICKET ROCK LIES N 55 DEG W MAGNETIC.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED.  IT HAS NO ROOF OR DEFINITE CENTER POINT.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE DETACHED ROCK OFF PULL POINT.  THIS IS THE PROMINENT POINT OF THE N SHORE LINE JUST E OF GREEN CAY AND N OF GREEN CAY ESTATE.  STATION IS ABOUT 5 FEET ABOVE HIGH WATER.  GREEN CAY POINT AND SHOYS POINT ARE ALMOST ON RANGE.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE.  ELEVATION OF STATION ABOUT 6 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) THIS STATION IS ON THE HIGH GRASSY HILL WESTWARD OF PUNCH ESTATE MILL ON THE WESTERN END OF THE ISLAND.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED INTO THE TOP OF A LOW OUTCROPPING ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) STATION NOT RECOVERED, BELIEVED DESTROYED DUE TO LEVELING OF HILLTOP.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 2.2 MI. NORTH OF FREDERIKSTED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (GCM) NO ATTEMPT MADE AT PHYSICAL RECOVERY.  SIGNAL ON TOP OF HILL VISIBLE FROM WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (KWJ) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION IS LOCATED AT THE PEAK OF RAM HILL WHICH IS THE FIRST HILL NORTH OF RAM HEAD ON THE SOUTHEAST COAST OF ST. JOHN ISLAND.  MARKED BY AN UNSTAMPED TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN A ROCK OUTCROPPING.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--5 MILES EAST OF CRUZ BAY, ST. JOHN.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE TOP OF SIGNAL HILL.  THIS HILL IS THE HIGH PROMINENT ONE RISING S OF CHRISTIANSTED.  NE CORNER OF THE FORT AND NE TANGENT TO PROTESTANT CAY ARE ON RANGE.  GREEN CAY ESTATE MILL AND BONTZBERG MILL PRACTICALLY ON RANGE.  SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK IN TOP OF A 6-INCH DIAMETER CEMENT POST 2-1/2 FEET LONG SET IN HOLE WHERE OLD SIGNAL POLE FORMERLY WAS.  IT IS SURROUNDED BY ROCKS AND OLD CONCRETE.  IT IS 10.4 METERS E OF WIRE FENCE.  SUBSURFACE MARK IS A SIMILAR POST BUT SHORTER.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A 1-METER DIAMETER BOULDER LYING ON N EDGE OF THE HILLTOP.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD DISK IN A 6-INCH OCTAGONAL CEMENT POST 3.25 METERS E OF THE FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A STANDARD DISK IN TOP OF A 6-INCH DIAMETER CEMENT POST.  TOP OF POLE - 3.67 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1921)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1921 (ERM) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED, AND WAS OBSERVED ON.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION WAS NOT VISITED.  USED FOR OFF-SHORE WORK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1953)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1953 STATION WAS PROBABLY DESTROYED.  THE TOP OF THIS HILL HAS BEEN GRADED OFF.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) STATION DESTROYED DUE TO CONSTRUCTION OF A VOR SITE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 0.8 MI. SOUTH OF CHRISTIANSTED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) DETACHED ROCK OFF RED POINT, ENTRANCE TO MOSQUITO BAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (KWJ) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--MILES WEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE, ST. THOMAS.
DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF THE ESTATE HOUSE ON REEF BAY ESTATE.  THIS ESTATE BORDERS ON REEF BAY, S SIDE OF ST. JOHN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (GCM) NO ATTEMPT MADE AT RECOVERY.  SIGNAL AT TOP OF HILL VISIBLE FROM WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (RDP) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF BOVOCOAP PT. ON THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF ST. JOHN ISLAND.  STATION IS MARKED BY AN IRON PIN CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING ROCK.  ONE REFERENCE MARK, A REGULATION BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK, WAS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 10 METERS SOUTH OF THE STATION.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 TO REACH THE MARK TRAVEL EAST FROM THE JUNCTION OF HWY.75 AND HWY.70 ALONG HWY.75 FOR 0.56 MI (0.9 KM) TO GOVERNMENT HOUSE AND MARK ON THE RIGHT. THE MARK IS A NGS VERTICAL CONTROL DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE.THE MARK IS 19.8 M (65.0 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF QUEENS CROSS STREET, 4.8 M (15.7 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF KING STREET, 2.1 M (6.9 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH FACE OF BUILDING AND 0.4 M (1.3 FT) ABOVE THE LEVEL OF THE STREET.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) MARK EASILY FOUND.  THIS ISLAND (COCKROACH ISLAND) IS DIFFICULT OF ASCENT FROM THE SOUTHWARD.  BETTER LANDINGS ARE HAD FROM THE S HOWEVER.  THE STATION MARK IS LOCATED ON THE TOP OF A GROUP OF BOULDERS NEARLY IN THE CENTER OF THE ISLAND.  THE MARK IS E OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE ISLAND, IN SOMEWHAT OF A CLEARING.  THERE IS A LARGE BOOBY ROOST TO THE EASTWARD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) THIS STATION IS LOCATED ON A LARGE OFFSHORE ROCK OFF COWELLS POINT ON HASSEL ISLAND.  THE ROCKS ABOUT 10 METERS FROM THE SHORE, IS WHERE STATION IS LOCATED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE ROCK AND NEAR ITS NORTHERN EDGE.  STATION IS IN RANGE WITH THE MORAVIAN CHURCH AT NISKY AND BANANA POINT ON WATER ISLAND.  REFERENCE MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE IN A BOULDER, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 12D.  IT BEARS N 79 DEG W AND IS 5 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION.  EAST POINT LIGHT BEARS S 75 DEG E FROM STATION.  SIGNAL STATION BEARS N 80 DEG E FROM STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JPR) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  STATION AND RM WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION ROTTO IS IN THE MIDDLE OF ROTTO CAY, JERSEY BAY, ABOUT 3.5 MILES E OF EAST POINT LIGHT.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED INTO A DEPRESSION OF A SMALL OUTCROPPING ROCK 7.2 METERS FROM THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE ISLAND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK WEDGED INTO A CREVICE OF THE EDGE OF THE CLIFF FORMING THE E SIDE OF THE ISLAND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD DISK WEDGED INTO A CREVICE OF OUTCROPPING ROCK.  BUCK ISLAND LIGHT IS IN AZIMUTH 36 DEG 59 MIN (TRUE) FROM THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1929)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1929 (GDC) STATION IS IN DANGER OF BEING LOST, THE ROCK IS DISINTEGRATING.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (JGC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  EAST POINT LIGHT IN THE 1918 DESCRIPTION NO LONGER EXISTS.  ROTTO CAY IS 1.3 MILES W. OF DECK POINT.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS IN DANGER OF BEING LOST DUE TO EROSION, NO. 2 AND THE STATION MARK ARE NOT IN DANGER OF BEING LOST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--4.6 MILE S.E. OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS IN THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE, OFFSHORE SOUTHWEST OF HAVENSIGHT POINT AT A CHARTED ROCKPILE KNOWN AS RUPERT ROCK WHICH LIES AT THE EAST EDGE OF ST THOMAS ISLAND.  THE OBJECT IS A CONCRETE PILE SET INTO A ROCK AWASH NEAR THE WEST EDGE OF THE ROCKPILE.  THE PILE HAS HAZARD DAYBOARDS AFFIXED TO ITS NORTH AND SOUTH FACINGS.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER TOP OF THE PILE WHICH WAS OBSERVED TO HAVE MOUNTING BOLTS SET INTO THE CONCRETE WHICH MAY BE INTENDED FOR FUTURE MOUNTING OF A LIGHT.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2008 (WEL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.6 MI (1.0 KM) EAST-NORTHEAST OF CRUZ BAY.  OWNERSHIP--ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN CRUZ BAY, GO NORTHWEST FOR ABOUT 70 M (229.7 FT) ALONG MAIN STREET, THEN TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST FOR 0.2 MI (0.3 KM) ON A STREET TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 10.  TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY FOR 0.55 MI (0.9 KM) ON HIGHWAY 10 TO A ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT, CROSS A BRIDGE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, AT THE END OF THE BRIDGE.   IT IS IN THE TOP OF THE NORTHEAST WING WALL OF THE BRIDGE, 16.3 M (53.5 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST FROM THE CENTERLINE OF  THE HIGHWAY, 15.5 M (50.9 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST FROM A UTILITY POLE, 15.0 M (49.2 FT) NORTHEAST FROM A UTILITY POLE WITH A TRANSFORMER, 3.4 M (11.2 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 0.3 M (1.0 FT) EAST FROM THE END OF THE BRIDGE ABUTMENT AND ABOUT LEVEL WITH ROAD.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN A MASSIVE RETAINING WALL
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK ON HIGHEST POINT OF SABA ISLAND.  STATION MARK FOUND ON WESTERNMOST PEAK OF SABA ISLAND, AND AT SUMMIT OF PEAK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1928)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1928 STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF SABA ISLAND, ON THE VERY EDGE OF A RAPIDLY DISINTEGRATING CLIFF, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK WITH ARROW POINTING SOUTHWARD WAS FOUND, CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE, IN A FLAT TOPPED ROCK APPROXIMATELY 0.7 METER WIDE AND 1.8 METERS LONG.  ABOUT 8 FEET S OF THIS REFERENCE MARK THE REMAINS OF A SIGNAL WERE FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (JKW) THE DESCRIPTION STATES THAT THE STATION IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK, HOWEVER NO STANDARD CENTERMARK DISK WAS FOUND AT THE STATION SITE. ONE STANDARD REFERENCE DISK AND A 1/2 INCH BRASS PLUG WAS FOUND, THE R. M. ARROW POINTING AS NEARLY AS POSSIBLE TO BRASS PLUG.  IT WAS ASSUMED THAT THE BRASS PLUG WAS THE CENTERMARK.  THIS POSITION WORKED OUT WELL IN DETERMINING A POSITION OF A TARGET ON SAVANA IS. FOR PHOTOGRAMMETRIC CONTROL.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--3.5 MILES SW OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (CHN) ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION NOT ADEQUATE--STATION IS NOW MARKED BY 1/2 INCH BRASS STEM OF A STANDARD BRASS DISC. TOP OF DISC HAS BEEN DESTROYED. THIS BRASS STEM IS ALMOST FLUSH WITH TOP OF ROCK INTO WHICH IT IS CEMENTED.  ROCK IN WHICH STATION IS CEMENTED IS FLAT-TOPPED, AND HAS REMAINS OF CONCRETE ON IT.  IT IS LOCATED ON HIGHEST POINT OF SABA ISLAND AT THE WESTERN END.  STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE MARK POINTING TO STATION WAS FOUND APPROXIMATELY 8 FT. NORTH OF STATION IN TOP OF FLAT-TOPPED BOULDER APPROXIMATELY 0.7 METERS WIDE AND 1.8 METERS LONG PROJECTING APPROXIMATELY 1 METER ABOVE GROUND.  PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION HELPFUL BUT NOT ADEQUATE OWING TO LOSS OF TOP OF BRASS DISC.  THIS STATION CAN ONLY BE REACHED BY SKIFF, LANDING IS COMPARATIVELY EASY ON WESTERN SIDE OF THE ISLAND.  LANDING SHOULD BE MADE AND SKIFF ANCHORED AWAY FROM BEACH AS SWELL WILL SWAMP SKIFF IF LEFT BEACHED. SABA IS STEEPLY SLOPING AND EASIEST WALKING IS TO BE FOUND FROM WESTERN SIDE OF ISLAND.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--4.5 MILES SOUTHWEST OF CENTER OF TOWN, CHARLOTTE AMALIE, ST. THOMAS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (JGC) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) DESTROYED.  ONLY RM REMAINS.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY OF REFERENCE MARK.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (KWJ) THE STATION IS ON THE SOUTH SHORE OF ST. JOHN ISLAND, VIRGIN ISLANDS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SADDLE BETWEEN RAM HILL AND RAM HEAD.  THE STATION IS APPROXIMATELY 50 FEET TOWARDS BOOBY, 1918 FROM SHEAR CLIFF AT TOP OF MARKED SCENIC TRAIL.  THE STATION IS BEST LOCATED BY LANDING ON BEACH OF COVE INSIDE RAM HEAD AND FOLLOWING TRAIL TO TOP OF BLUFF.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SAD 1967 BRAZED TO A 5/8 INCH COPPER PIPE DRIVEN 4.5 FEET INTO GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (JGC) THE STATION IS ON THE SOUTH SHORE OF ST. JOHN ISLAND ON THE FLATTEST GROUND BETWEEN RAM HILL AND RAM HEAD.  IT IS ABOUT 50 FEET WEST OF A CLIFF THAT DROPS OFF INTO THE SEA.  IT IS BEST REACHED BY A NATIONAL PARK TRAIL WHICH ASCENDS THE WEST SIDE OF THE POINT.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SAD 1967.  THE DISK IS BRAZED TO A 5/8 INCH COPPER PIPE DRIVEN 4.5 FEET INTO THE GROUND.
markers.setting: undefinedMETAL ROD DRIVEN INTO GROUND. SEE TEXT FOR ADDITIONAL
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) THE SUMMIT OF THE LARGE AND REMARKABLE CRAG WHICH BEARS THE ABOVE NAME.  OWING TO THE GREAT DIFFICULTY OF LANDING UPON AND CLIMBING THIS ROCK, NO SIGNAL WAS PUT UP AND POINTINGS WERE MADE, AS NEARLY AS POSSIBLE, UPON THE SUMMIT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1914)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1914 (GDC) STATION STILL AVAILABLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (CHN) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND USED AS A HYDROGRAPHIC SIGNAL BY NOAA SHIP WHITING IN 1972.  NO LANDING WAS ATTEMPTED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--10.4 MILES WEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION SAINT IS AN INTERSECTION STATION ON THE SW POINT OF GREAT ST. JAMES ISLAND.  THE POINT IS COMPOSED OF A HIGH BOLD FLAT-TOPPED ROCK.  FRENCHMANS CAP IS SLIGHTLY TO THE EASTWARD OF A LINE RUNNING FROM THE STATION TO THE OUTER END OF THE REEF CALLED THE STRAGGLERS.  THIS REEF IS ABOUT 250 METERS SOUTHWARD OF THE STATION.  MARKED BY A STANDARD TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED INTO A DEPRESSION OF THE ROCK.  BUCK ISLAND LIGHT IS S 63 DEG 43 MIN W (TRUE) AND BENNER IS N 44 DEG 01 MIN 42 SEC W (TRUE).                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (JGC) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE TOP OF A GRASSY HILL AT SALT RIVER POINT.  THIS POINT FORMS THE EASTERN ENTRANCE TO SALT RIVER.  IT IS JUST INSHORE OF WHITE HORSE ROCKS.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN DEPRESSION OF ROCK OUTCROPPING 1-FOOT ON W END OF HILLTOP.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN ROCK ON THE E SIDE OF THE SLOPE LEADING TO THE STATION.  SLOPE DISTANCE FROM STATION IS 5.08 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK ON NW SLOPE OF HILLTOP.  IT IS ABOUT 10 FEET BELOW STATION.  SLOPE DISTANCE FROM THE STATION IS 9.25 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN ROCK ON NE EDGE OF HILLTOP.  SLOPE DISTANCE FROM THE STATION IS 3.32 METERS.  TOP OF POLE - 3.98 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION WAS NOT VISITED.  USED IN OFF-SHORE WORK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1953)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1953 STATION WAS PROBABLY DESTROYED.  THE TOP OF THE HILL HAS BEEN GRADED OFF.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS SITUATED ON THE NW CORNER OF SALT CAY.  IT IS ON THE TOP OF A PROMINENT ROCK, WHICH IS NOT DETACHED FROM THE ISLAND.  STATION IS MARKED BY A REGULATION BRASS DISK (HYDROGRAPHIC) CEMENTED INTO A CREVICE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) DIFFICULT LANDING TO STATION PRECLUDED RECOVERY, ALTHOUGH THIS STATION WAS USED IN INSHORE HYDROGRAPHY ONCE OR TWICE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1954)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1954 STATION WAS NOT FOUND.  DESCRIPTION IS NOT VERY GOOD, ALL LIKELY ROCKS ON THE TWO POINTS INVESTIGATED.  THERE IS ONE DETACHED ROCK THAT MIGHT HOLD THIS MARK BUT WOULD TAKE A LADDER TO GET ON IT.  IT IS SURROUNDED BY WATER.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON SALT POINT, JUST SOUTH OF SALT RIVER BAY.  TO REACH FROM FORT CHRISTIANSVAERN, IN CHRISTIANSTED GO SOUTHWEST ON ONE WAY STREET FOR 0.6 KM (0.35 MI) TO A CROSS STREET TURN RIGHT AND GO ONE BLOCK TO A CROSSSTREET, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWEST THEN WEST FOR 0.6 KM (0.35 MI) TO A CROSSROAD. AT STOPLIGHT.  GO STRAIGHT, WESTERLY, FOR 1.0 KM (0.6 MI) TO A SIDEROAD RIGHT AT STOPLIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH FOR 2.7 KM (1.7 MI) TO A SIDEROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH FOR 1.9 KM (1.2 MI) TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO A CROSSROAD,  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON MAIN ROAD FOR 0.6 KM (0.4 MI) TO A ROCK AND GRAVEL BARACADE ACROSS ROAD AND STATION ON PLATEAU ABOVE AND ON THE LEFT.  THE PROPERTY OWNER OF HOUSE ON RIGHT JUST BEFORE REACHING STATION WAS PRETTY EMPHATIC ABOUT NOT CROSSING THE BARACADE WITH A VEHICLE.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---SALT 2 1980---, CEMENTED IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE, FLUSH. IT IS LOCATED, 2.9 METERS (9.5 FT) SOUTH FROM THE NORTH EDGE OF PLATEAU, 5.7 METERS (18.6 FT) WEST FROM THE EAST EDGE OF PLATEAU AND 4.7 METERS (15.4 FT) EAST FROM THE WEST EDGE OF PLATEAU.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.5 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1980.
markers.setting: undefinedOBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED 3.5 MILES NORTHWEST OF CHRISTIANSTED ON THE EAST SIDE OF SALT RIVER BAY. TO REACH FROM END OF ROAD ON SALT POINT AT STATION SALT 2 GO SOUTHEAST ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.3 KM (0.2 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT,GRAPETREE RD., TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT . KEEP RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT KEEP RIGHT NORTHWEST FOR 0.3 KM (0.2 MI) TO WHERE THE ROAD IS NEXT TO SHORELINE AND TURNS TO THE SOUTH. GO SOUTH FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ALONG SHORE FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO END OF ROAD AND STATION TO SOUTHWEST.  THE STATION IS A NOS BRASS DISK STAMPED---SALT BAY 1982---, CEMENTED IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 3 INCHES BELOW GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS LOCATED, 5.5 METERS (18.0 FT) EAST FROM WEST EDGE OF FILL ON LEVEL GROUND NEAR WATER EDGE, 4.9 METERS (16.0 FT) NORTH FRON SOUTH EDGE OF FILL ON LEVEL GROUND NEAR WATER EDGE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.6 METERS. DESCRIBED BY MWJ.
markers.setting: undefinedOBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PEAK, NEAR THE SOUTHWESTERN END OF THE DANISH ISLAND OF THAT NAME.  THE ISLAND IS DENSELY COVERED WITH A SCRUBBY GROWTH.  A PATHWAY WAS CUT FROM A COVE ON THE S SIDE, BUT THE LANDING WAS GENERALLY VERY BAD.  MARKED BY A 2-INCH IRON PIPE SET IN A BED OF CONCRETE, TOPPED OFF WITH PURE CEMENT.  ABOUT 3 INCHES OF THE PIPE PROJECTS ABOVE THE CEMENT.  QUADRUPED SIGNAL, 30-FOOT LEGS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (KWJ) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND WAS IN GOOD CONDITION.  PEAK IS COVERED WITH VERY DENSE BRUSH.  EASIEST ACCESS IS FROM COVE ON SOUTH SIDE.  PATHWAY GOES UP SOUTH SIDE OF PEAK.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED.  THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE IS STILL THERE BUT NO DEFINITE CENTER COULD BE DETERMINED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) ON FIRST PEAK W OF TRIANGULATION STATION CALEDONIA AND ON THE SAME RIDGE.  IT IS NOT A PEAK BUT JUST A LEVEL STRETCH OF THE RIDGE.  PUNCH MILL IS OPEN ABOUT 8 METERS TO THE E OF MT. VICTORY MILL.  STATION IS 3 METERS N OF CENTER OF RIDGE.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A 0.3-METER DIAMETER ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN A 1 BY 0.6-METER BOULDER.  THIS BOULDER IS ONE OF THREE OF ITS KIND FORMING A GROUP ON THE N BREAK OF THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE OF A FLAT ROCK FORMING THE EASTERN END OF A LEDGE 2 METERS LONG AND 0.4 METER WIDE OUTCROPPING 0.1 METER IN CENTER OF THE RIDGE  TOP OF POLE - 3.03 METERS.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (GCM) STATION IS DESCRIBED IN BUOY LIST, 1925, U.S. LIGHTHOUSE SERVICE. PAGE 19.  MAIN CHANNEL CHRISTIANSTED GREAT MIDDLE GROUND FRONT BEACON, ON AXIS OF CHANNEL BETWEEN GREAT MIDDLE GROUND AND ROUND REEF.  STRUCTURE IS LOCATED ON LONG REEF AND IS 14 FEET HIGH CONSISTING OF TWO WHITE TRIANGULAR DAYMARKS, APEX TO APEX ON PYRAMIDAL CONCRETE BASE.  STATION IS APPROXIMATELY 1/2 MILE NORTHWESTWARD OF FORT LOUISA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST HILL OF THE ISLAND E OF CHRISTIANSTED.  THIS HILL IS S OF COAKLEY BAY ESTATE AND MIDWAY BETWEEN N AND S SHORES.  THE STATION CAN BE REACHED BEST FROM COAKLEY BAY ESTATE.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION MARK IN THE TOP OF A CEMENT POST.  REFERENCE MARKS WERE PUT IN BUT THEIR DISCRIPTION WAS LEFT UNTIL THE STATION SHOULD BE OCCUPIED.  AN 8-FOOT SCAFFOLD WAS ERECTED OVER THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1921)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1921 (ERH) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT THAT THERE WERE NO REFERENCE MARKS DESCOVERED, AND PARTY HAD NO TIME TO RETURN TO PLACE SUCH MARKS.  THIS STATION OCCUPIED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1919.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR BRIEFLY, BUT NOT FOUND.  IT IS POSSIBLE THEY WERE NOT SET WHEN STATION WAS ESTABLISHED.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE DOCK AREA IN CHRISTIANSTED, FOLLOW THE MAIN ROAD EAST FOR 3.1 MILES TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT, SOUTHERLY, AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD LEFT AND SIGN, ENTRANCE TO ESTATE OF SEVEN HILLS.  TURN LEFT AND CONTINUE 0.35 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND FOLLOW THE MAIN, WINDING ROAD THROUGH THE ESTATES FOR 1.1 MILES TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT, UPHILL, AND CONTINUE EASTERLY FOR 0.1 MILE TO END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE, PACK SOUTHEASTERLY, FOLLOWING A FENCELINE TO THE TOP OF THE HIGHEST HILL IN THE AREA AND THE STATION.  A 1 1/2-HOUR PACK.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED SEVEN, IS 5.5 METERS SOUTH OF THE EAST-WEST FENCELINE.  IT IS SET IN A 5 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  THIS AREA IS STILL BEING DEVELOPED, SO THERE WILL BE EASIER WAYS TO REACH THE STATION IN THE FUTURE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 4.3 MI. EAST OF CHRISTIANSTED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS SITUATED ON TOP OF SHARK ISLAND, LYING OFF THE NORTHEASTERN END OF ST. THOMAS ISLAND.  STATION IS MARKED BY A REGULATION BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A BOULDER LYING NEAR THE EASTERN CLIFF OF THE ISLAND.  THE BOULDER IS NOT ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE ISLAND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN CRACK OF LARGE LOW LYING ROCK IN ABOUT THE MIDDLE OF THE ISLAND.  REFERENCE MARK BEARS N 40 DEG E (MAGNETIC) AND IS 5.13 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION.  E SIDE OF ISLAND IS 1.5 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION AND S SIDE OF ISLAND IS 38.0 METERS, DISTANT FROM THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION IS ON SHARK ISLAND.  RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM NOT SEARCHED FOR.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.
DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE FIRST HILL E OF LOWRY HILL HOUSE SITUATED ON THE DIVIDE ALONG THE ROAD LEADING TOWARDS PETRONELLA ESTATE.  THIS HILL IS S OF THE SOMEWHAT LOWER ONE RISING TO THE LEEWARD DIRECTLY FROM THE SADDLE.  THE STATION IS IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF THE HILL.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK IN TOP OF A 6-INCH OCTAGONAL CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 6 INCHES.  SUBSURFACE MARK IS A SIMILAR DISK IN A SHORTER CONCRETE POST.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE DISK IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH OCTAGONAL CONCRETE POST SET ON THE SW BREAK OF THE HILLTOP.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A SIMILAR MARK SET ON THE NW BREAK.  STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK NO.1 AND PETRONELLA MILL ARE ON LINE.  TOP OF POLE - 3.06 METERS ABOVE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (BAW) STATION SURFACE MARK HAS BEEN MOVED BY A BULLDOZER, BUT THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION AND NOT DISTURBED.  A CONCRETE PAD WAS POURED AROUND SITE OF STATION MARK.  THERE IS A SAND-FILLED HOLE WITH THE SUB-SURFACE MARK UNDISTURBED.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS BROKEN BY BULLDOZER, BUT BOTTOM OF MARKER STILL IN PLACE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS JARRED BY BULLDOZER, BUT STILL IN PLACE.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE OLD MILL STILL EXISTS, BUT THERE IS NO ROOF OR DEFINITE CENTER POINT.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE CENTRAL PART OF ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS ABOUT 1 MI (1.6 KM) NORTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE AT THE MOUNTAINTOP ESTATES AT THE HIGHEST GROUND POINT OF SIGNAL HILL. THE OBJECT IS A TRUSSWORK STEEL TOWER WITH A RED OBSTRUCTION LIGHT AT THE TOP.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE OBSTRUCTION LIGHT.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE CENTRAL PART OF ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS ABOUT 1 MI (1.6 KM) NORTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE AT THE MOUNTAINTOP ESTATES ON THE NORTH SIDE OF SIGNAL HILL. THE OBJECT IS A RED AND WHITE TRUSSWORK STEEL TOWER WITH A VERTICAL CYLINDER AT THE TOP.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE TOP CYLINDER.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON PROPERTY OF MR YANCE SKOW, STAR RT 00864 TEAGUE BAY, ST CROIX, 00820. IT IS ABOUT 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) WEST OF TAGUE POINT, ON THE NORTH EDGE OF THE FIRST SMALL HILL SOUTH OF THE BAY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM FORT CHRISTIANSVAERN IN CHRISTIANSTED, GO EAST ON EAST END ROAD FOR 5.1 KM (3.2 MI) TO A T-INTERSECTION, AND AN OLD MILL, TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW MAIN ROAD FOR 6.4 KM (4.0 MI) EASTERLY TO A PAVED DRIVE ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY FOR 0.2 KM (0.15 MI) UP HILL, TO A HOUSE, CONTINUE PAST THE HOUSE WESTERLY ON A DIRT ROAD PASSING THROUGH TWO GATES FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO MR YANCE SKOWS HOUSE AND THE STATION.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---SKOW 1980---, CEMENTED IN THE TOP OF A IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE ON TOP OF BEDROCK. IT IS LOCATED 24.9 METERS (81.6 FT) WEST FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF HOUSE AND 5.5 METERS (18.1 FT) EAST FROM A WOVEN WIRE FENCE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.4 METERS.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) ON THE LOW OUTSIDE PART OF THE POINT THAT RUNS OUT FROM SOLITUDE ESTATE, N SIDE OF ST. CROIX NEAR THE E END.  THIS IS THE SECOND POINT E OF COAKLEY BAY.  THE STATION IS 6 INCHES ABOVE HIGH WATER.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1921)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1921 (ERH) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.  INTERSECTION STATION BY THIS PARTY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1975 STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  CONCRETE BLOB WITH HOLE IN CENTER WAS FOUND IN DEPRESSION IN ROCK, BUT MARK WAS MISSING.  STATION PROBABLY DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. NOTE, THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE EXTREME NORTH POINT OF SOL POINT AND IS AWASH MOST OF THE TIME.  TO REACH FROM FORT CHRISTIANVERN IN CHRISTIANSTED GO EASTERLY ON EAST END ROAD FOR 5.1 KM (3.2 MI) TO A T ROAD TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH THEN EAST ON MAIN ROAD FOR 3.6 KM (2.25 MI) TO A HOUSE ON LEFT AND BOAT ANCHORAGE IN SMALL COVE. (THE PROPERTY OWNER AT THIS RESIDENCE SHOULD BE CONTRACTED PRIOR TO LEAVING VEHICLE) PACK EAST IN FRONT OF HOUSE TO A FENCE CORNER THEN NORTH ALONG EAST SIDE OF FENCE TO BEACH THENCE EAST AND NORTH ALONG BEACH AND SHALLOW WATER TO END OF POINT AND STATION, 15 MINUTE PACK.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.5 METERS.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) SOLITUDE MILL IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THERE IS NO ROOF OR DEFINITE CENTER POINT ON THIS STRUCTURE.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS ON JOHN SOLOMON HILL, FORMERLY CALLED CANOE HILL, ON THE EXTREME NORTHWESTERN END OF ST. JOHN.  THIS HILL RISES SOUTHWARD FROM K. C. BAY.  THIS STATION IS MARKED BY A ROUND-HEADED COPPER BOLT CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN FLAT BOULDER ON TOP OF THE HILL.  THIS STATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE DANES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A 4 BY 3 BY 3-FOOT BOULDER ON SOUTHWEST EDGE OF RIDGE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK IN A DRILL HOLE IN A 1-1/2 BY 3-FOOT BOULDER STANDING 6 FEET HIGH ON SE EDGE OF RIDGE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INTER-AMERICAN GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (CEG) STATION IS ROUND-HEADED COPPER BOLT IN FLAT BOULDER ON HIGHEST POINT OF SOLOMON HILL (CANOE HILL), THE HILL RISING S FROM CANEEL BAY (K.C. BAY).  HILL IS THICKLY WOODED WITH BRUSH UP TO 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND 20 FEET IN HEIGHT.  TO REACH STATION FROM CRUZ BAY, PROCEED E ON CENTER ROAD APPROXIMATELY 1-1/8 MILES TO A SHARP SWITCH-BACK TO THE RIGHT.  THIS SWITCH-BACK IS ABOUT 1/5 MILE SE OF THE SADDLE BETWEEN MARGARET HILL AND SOLOMON HILL.  FROM THE SWITCH-BACK FOLLOW WELL-DEFINED TRAIL NW TO PASTURE PLOTS ON S SIDE OF RIDGE E OF SOLOMON HILL.  PROCEED ALONG RIDGE THROUGH PASTURE PLOTS TO THE MOST W PASTURE FROM WHICH POINT ILL-DEFINED GOAT TRAILS LEAD W ALONG RIDGE TOP TO THE HILLTOP AND STATION.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRASS DISKS CEMENTED IN PROMINENT BOULDERS.
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION IS THE LIGHT ATOP THE SOUTHWEST CAPE NAVIGATION LIGHT, A 4 LEG STEEL STRUCTURE APPROXIMATELY 40 FEET IN HEIGHT, WITH A SMALL ENCLOSURE ON WEST SIDE AND BELOW THE LIGHT THAT HOUSES A THEODOLITE STAND.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE WEST END OF ST CROIX BETWEEN BUTLER BAY AND SPRAT HALL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE FREDERIKSTED PIER GO EAST FOR 1 BLOCK TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH FOR 3.9 KM (2.45 MI) TO THE BURBANKS RESIDENCE ON THE RIGHT AND STATION ON ROCKY SHORELINE TO LEFT, APPROXIMATELY 35 METERS NORTH OF A CONCRETE WALL ON EDGE OF ROAD.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---SPRAT 1980---, CEMENTED IN A MASS OF CONCRETE IN THE ROCK, FLUSH. IT IS LOCATED 19 METERS (62.4 FT) WEST FROM THE WEST EDGE OF ROAD AND 2.0 METERS (6.5 FT) EAST FROM THE EDGE OF SHORELINE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.5 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) THIS STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SE CORNER OF WATER ISLAND ON WHAT IS KNOWN AS SPRAT POINT.  IT IS ON A BALD ROCKY PROMONTORY ABOUT 50 FEET HIGH.  FROM THE CENTER OF THE STATION FRENCHMANS CAP SHOWS JUST INSIDE THE RIGHT TANGENT OF BUCK ISLAND.  THE RIGHT TANGENT OF GREEN CAY IS JUST OUTSIDE OF THE LONG POINT BEYOND.  MARKED BY REGULATION BRASS DISK WEDGED IN A DRILL HOLE OF A BOULDER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED.  LANDING VERY DIFFICULT.  SHOULD BE APPROACHED FROM WESTWARD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) STATION SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  DESCRIPTION WAS NOT ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.  ROCKY POINT HAS BEEN BADLY ERODED BY WAVE ACTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JPR) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  STATION WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (CHN) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY O.W.S. IN 1918 IN GOOD CONDITION.  LANDING MUST BE MADE ON SPRAT POINT BECAUSE STATION CANNOT BE APPROACHED FROM OTHER PARTS OF WATER ISLAND DUE TO CLIFF ABOVE POINT ON WHICH STATION IS LOCATED.  LANDING SHOULD BE MADE BY SKIFF FROM THE WESTWARD IN PERIODS OF CALM WITH ALMOST NO SWELLS RUNNING.  LANDING IS DIFFICULT BUT CAN BE ACCOMPLISHED AT THESE TIMES IF CARE IS TAKEN.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE DESCRIBED BY O.W.S. IN 1918.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--1.5 MILES SOUTH SOUTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE STATION SITE WAS NOT VISITED, BUT THE MILL IS VISABLE FROM SCENIC ROAD.  IT HAS NO ROOF OR DEFINITE CENTER POINT.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE EAST PART OF THE ALEXANDER HAMILTON AIRPORT, ST CROIX, USVI. IT IS LOCATED 39.81 M (130.61 FT) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE TAXIWAY CENTERLINE LEADING TO END 27, 38.25 M (125.49 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE RUNWAY CENTERLINE, 15.27 M (50.10 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY, 13.53 M (44.39 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE BASE OF TAXIWAY SIGN A, 15.27 M (50.10 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE FIRST RUNWAY LIGHT, 20.06 M (65.81 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A 6X6 FOOT CONCRETE BASE FOR A CABLE VAULT AND 38.71 M (127.00 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A LINE OF PROLONGATION FOR THE HOLD BAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE EAST PART OF THE AIRPORT NEAR RUNWAY END 27.  IT IS LOCATED 130.6 FT (39.8 M) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE TAXIWAY CENTERLINE LEADING TO END 27, 125.5 FT (38.3 M) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE RUNWAY CENTERLINE, 50.1 FT (15.3 M) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY 44.4 FT (13.5 M) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE BASE OF TAXIWAY A SIGN, 50.1 FT (15.3 M) SOUTHEAST OF THE FIRST RUNWAY LIGHT, 65.8 FT (20.1 M) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A 6 FT (1.8 M) X 6 FT (1.8 M) CONCRETE BASE FOR A CABLE VAULT, AND 127 FT (38.7 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A LINE OF PROLONGATION FOR THE HOLD BAR.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD TOPOGRAPHIC DISK STAMPED AP 1965 STA B AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST THAT IS 0.7 FT (21.3 CM) BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1996)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) NOTE--THIS IS A SAC STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE ALEXANDER HAMILTON AIRPORT, ST CROIX, U.S.  VIRGIN ISLANDS, IN THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE JUNCTION OF RUNWAY 27 AND THE CONNECTOR TAXI TO RUNWAY END 27.  OWNERSHIP--VIRGIN ISLANDS PORT AUTHORITY, P.O.  BOX 1134, ST CROIX, U.S.  VIRGIN ISLANDS.  JEFF LAWLOR IS SENIOR ENGINEER OF THE AIRPORT.  PHONE 809-778-1012, FAX 809-778-1033.  CONTACT HIM FOR PERMISSION TO OCCUPY THIS STATION AND TO ARRANGE FOR ESCORT IF NEEDED. THE STATION IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 30 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST RECESSED 25 CM BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE POST HAS BEEN HIT (POSSIBLY BY A BLADE DURING DRAINAGE DITCH CONSTRUCTION) AND SOME OF THE CONCRETE IS MISSING BUT THE STATION IS STABLE AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 39.8 M (130.6 FT) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE TAXI CENTERLINE LEADING TO THE RUNWAY END, 38.1 M (125.0 FT) SOUTH 0F THE RUNWAY CENTER, 13.3 M (43.6 FT) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF A 0.2 M (0.7 FT) X 0.3 M (1.0 FT) STEEL PLATE AT THE CURVED SOUTH EDGE OF THE RUNWAY, 13.5 M (44.3 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE BASE OF TAXI SIGN A, 15.3 M (50.2 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE FIRST RUNWAY LIGHT FROM THE END, 20.1 M (65.9 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A 6X6 FOOT SQUARE CONCRETE BASE FOR A CABLE VAULT, AND 37.1 M (121.7 FT) NORTH OF CENTER OF THE EXTENSION OF THE STOP LINE. DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 (RWA) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY PBS&J 2010 (RDM) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE MIDSECTION OF THE ALEXANDER HAMILTON AIRPORT, ST CROIX, USVI. IT IS LOCATED 16.76 M (54.99 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE RUNWAY, 17.13 M (56.20 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER ONE OF THREE RUNWAY LIGHTS, 24.51 M (80.41 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF TAXIWAY SIGN EF AND 30.24 M (99.21 FT) EAST OF TAXIWAY SIGN E.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1993 THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN THE MIDSECTION OF THE ALEXANDER HAMILTON AIRPORT, IN A GRASSY TRIANGLE AREA FORMED BY THE RUNWAY AND TWO TAXIWAYS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 55.0 FT (16.8 M) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE RUNWAY, 56.2 FT (17.1 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER 1 OF 3 RUNWAY LIGHTS, 80.4 FT (24.5 M) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF A TAXIWAY SIGN (E F), AND 99.2 FT (30.2 M) EAST OF A TAXIWAY SIGN (E).  THE STATION IS A STANDARD TOPOGRAPHIC DISK, STAMPED ARP 1965, SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8 INCH CONCRETE POST AND ABOUT 1 INCH BELOW THE SURFACE. THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE ALEXANDER HAMILTON AIRPORT, ST CROIX, U.S.  VIRGIN ISLANDS, ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE RUNWAY, JUST WEST OF THE CENTER OF A TRIANGULAR SHAPED GRASS ISLAND FORMED BY THE JUNCTION OF THE RUNWAY AND TAXIS E AND F, AND NEAR MIDFIELD.  OWNERSHIP--VIRGIN ISLANDS PORT AUTHORITY, P.O. BOX 1134, ST CROIX, U.S.  VIRGIN ISLANDS.  JEFF LAWLOR IS SENIOR ENGINEER OF THE AIRPORT.  PHONE 809-778-1012, FAX 809-778-1033. CONTACT HIM FOR PERMISSION TO OCCUPY THIS STATION AND TO ARRANGE FOR ESCORT IF NEEDED. THE STATION IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 25 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST RECESSED 5 CM BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 16.5 M (54.1 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE RUNWAY, 17.1 M (56.1 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER ONE OF THREE RUNWAY LIGHTS ON THE GRASS ISLAND, 17.8 M (58.4 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF RUNWAY AND TAXI SIGN 9-27 E, AND 30.2 M (99.1 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF TAXI SIGN E. markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS NEAR THE SE CORNER OF A BRIDGE ON CENTER LINE ROAD.  THE BRIDGE IS OVER THE STREAM THAT RUNS THROUGH HOGENSBORG ESTATE ABOUT 200 METERS W OF ESTATE HOUSE.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK IN AN 8-INCH SQUARE CEMENT POST, 18 INCHES LONG, PROJECTING 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND, 1 METER SW OF THE EASTERN CORNER POST OF THE S WALL OF THE BRIDGE.  (SUBSURFACE MARK.)  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN THE FLAT-TOPPED PART OF THE N WALL OF THE BRIDGE AND ABOUT THE MIDDLE OF THE BRIDGE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN THE TOP OF THE S WALL AT THE SMALL CURVE FORMING THE EASTERN END OF THE WALL.  IT IS 1/2 METER FROM THE CORNER POST.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN THE WALL AT THE W SIDE OF THE ENTRANCE TO HOGENSBORG ESTATE GROUNDS.  IT IS 0.15 METER W OF THE WESTERN POST OF THE ENTRANCE.  TOP 4 BY 4 POLE - 4.24 METERS.  TOP 2 BY 2 POLE - 1.56 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (VES) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARKS NO.1, NO.2, AND NO.3 WERE DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION AND OTHER ACTIVITY IN THE AREA.  REFERENCE MARK NO.4 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  TO REACH STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FREDERIKSTED GO SOUTH ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE, TURN EAST ON CENTERLINE ROAD FOR 2.1 MILES TO STATION ON RIGHT.  THE STATION IS 91 FT. EAST OF THE CENTER OF SOUTH SIDE OF A BRIDGE, 21.8 FT. SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF CENTERLINE ROAD, 5.1 FT. SOUTHWEST OF SOUTHEAST END OF BRIDGE WINGWALL, AND 4.5 FT. NORTHEAST OF A MIMOSA 8 INCHES IN DIAMETER.  THE MONUMENT IS ABOUT 2 INCHES BELOW THE SURROUNDING SURFACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) STATION DESTROYED DUE TO BRIDGE CONSTRUCTION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 2.4 MI. EAST OF FREDERIKSTED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE HIGH GROUND ABOUT 150 METERS BACK OF THE SHORE LINE OF BREIDS BAY.  THIS BAY IS S OF ENFIELD GREEN AND W OF BETTYS HOPE.  LONG POINT IS TO THE WESTWARD 1/2 MILE.  THE STATION IS 24.50 METERS W OF THE N AND S FENCE.  MARKED BY AN 8-INCH SQUARE CEMENT POST HAVING A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK IN ITS TOP.  POST PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  SUBSURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE BEDROCK ABOUT 1 FOOT BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  POST WAS SURROUNDED WITH A MASS OF CEMENT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A SMALL ROCK 5.7 METERS W OF THE FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A SIMILAR DISK CEMENTED IN A WHITE FLAT OUTCROPPING ROCK, 10 METERS FROM THE FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A DISK IN TOP OF A 6-INCH OCTAGONAL CEMENT POST, PROJECTING 1 FOOT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.4 IS A SIMILAR DISK CEMENTED IN A FLAT OUTCROPPING ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1954)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1954 (JOP) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY O.W.S. IN 1919.  THE SURFACE MARK HAD BEEN MOVED ABOUT 0.06 METERS BUT THE UNDERGROUND MARK WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AND THE SURFACE MARK WAS REPLACED OVER IT.  REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT 1 AND 2 COULD NOT BE FOUND.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON LONG POINT, ABOUT 1 MILE FROM MR. MALCOM SKOECHS DISTILLERY AND 82 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTH GATE POST IN A NORTH-SOUTH LINE.  THE POINT AS OCCUPIED BY THE AIR FORCE SHORAN PARTY IS AS SHOWN BELOW.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (VES) THE STATION, REFERENCE MARK NO.3, AND REFERENCE MARK NO.4 WERE RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.4 WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO.3 WERE FOUND TO BE INSTABLE.  THE REFERENCE DISTANCES WERE CHECKED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) STATION DESTROYED.  AREA HAS BEEN BLADED AND LEVELED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 3.8 MI. SOUTHEAST OF FREDERIKSTED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (PDC) RM2 AND RM4 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND LAYING ON ITS SIDE, THE SUBSURFACE MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--APPROX. 3 MILES SOUTHWEST OF FREDERIKSTED.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS NEAR THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND IN CHARLOTTE AMALIE ON BERG HILL.  THE OBJECT IS AN ORANGE AND WHITE DAYBOARD AFFIXED TO A SKELETON STEEL TOWER AND TOPPED OFF WITH A DIRECTIONAL LIGHT.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE DIRECTIONAL LIGHT.  THIS IS LIGHT NUMBER 27395 IN THE 1993 EDITION OF THE U.S.C.G. LIGHT LIST VOLUME III.  THE LIGHT LIST GIVES THE NAME OF THE LIGHT AS BERG HILL RANGE FRONT LIGHT BUT THE OLDER NAME WHICH APPEARED IN THE NGSIDB HAS BEEN PRESERVED.
NO DESCRIPTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS NEAR THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND IN CHARLOTTE AMALIE ON THE TOP OF BERG HILL.  THE OBJECT IS AN ORANGE AND WHITE DAYBOARD AFFIXED TO A SKELETON STEEL TOWER AND TOPPED OFF WITH A DIRECTIONAL LIGHT. THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE DIRECTIONAL LIGHT. THIS IS LIGHT NUMBER 27400 IN THE 1993 EDITION OF THE U.S.C.G. LIGHT LIST VOLUME III.  THE LIGHT LIST GIVES THE NAME OF THE LIGHT AS BERG HILL RANGE REAR LIGHT BUT THE OLDER NAME WHICH APPEARED IN THE NGSIDB HAS BEEN PRESERVED.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS IN THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND AT THE EAST SIDE OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE ON THE ROOF OF THE ST THOMAS HOSPITAL.  THE STATION IS A SILVER COLORED ALUMINUM VENTILATOR WITH A SOMEWHAT CONICAL TOP.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE VENTILATOR.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE POST ABOUT A FOOT SQUARE SUNK IN THE GROUND ABOUT 18 INCHES AND PROJECTING ABOVE THE SPARSLEY COVERED GRASSY FIELD ABOUT 3 INCHES.  THE STATION MARK IS LOCATED ON THE NE CORNER OF THE COMPARATIVELY LEVEL GROUND KNOWN AS SUGAR ESTATE.  IT IS AT THE FOOT OF WINTBERG PEAK.  WINTBERG PEAK, NORTH BASE AND FLOATING DOCK ARE ON RANGE.  SOUTHERN END OF THE WEST INDIA WHARF IS ON RANGE WITH THE POWDER MAGAZINE ON HASSEL ISLAND.  THE SE TANGENT OF THE LOWEST PART OF FREDERICKSBERG HILL, IS ON LINE WITH SIGNAL HASSEL.  WITNESS MARKS ARE REGULATION REFERENCE MARKS SET HORIZONTALLY IN BLAZES AT THE FOOT OF THREE TREES ARRANGED IN THE FORM OF A TRIANGLE.  STATION IS NEARLY ON LINE WITH WITNESS MARKS NO.1 AND NO.3.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (JH) THE STATION IS REPORTED LOST, THE MARKER EVIDENTLY HAVING BEEN REMOVED.  ALL EFFORTS TO FIND IT HAVE FAILED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS A REGULATION TRIANGULATION DISK SET IN A CONCRETE POST ABOUT A FOOT SQUARE SUNK IN THE GROUND ABOUT 18 INCHES AND PROJECTING ABOVE THE GROUND ABOUT 6 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED ON THE KNOLL ON HAVENSIGHT POINT AND S OF A PATHWAY LEADING SE FROM THE SW CORNER OF THE WEST INDIA WHARF, TO THE WHARF MANAGERS HOUSE. IT IS 11.6 METERS FROM AN IRON FENCE THAT RUNS ALONG S SIDE OF PATH.  THE PLACE IS COVERED WITH A THICK GROWTH OF PRICKLY BUSH, (ACACIA AND PING-WING).  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE AND CEMENTED IN THE NW CORNER OF OLD RUINS (STONE WALL) NW OF STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING ROCK ON N SIDE OF PATH.  ELEVATION BY TOPOGRAPHY 52 FEET.  ELEVATION BY LEVELS 49 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1955)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1955 (JOP) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND THE STATION MARK AND R. M. NO.1 WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. NO.2 IS PRESUMED LOST AS NO TRACE OF IT COULD BE FOUND.  THE STATION WAS NOT OCCUPIED AT THIS TIME.  THE WHARF MANAGERS HOUSE WAS TORN DOWN OR DESTROYED BY A HURRICANE A NUMBER OF YEARS AGO.  THE STATION IS 53 YARDS WEST-NORTH-WEST OF THE NORTH-WEST CORNER OF A HOUSE THAT IS FACING THE HARBOR ENTRANCE.  THE HOUSE IS THE MOST WESTWARDLY ONE OF THREE THAT ARE ON THE HILLSIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED AND ARE PRESUMED DESTROYED DUE TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF A PARKING LOT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--LONG BAY, CHARLOTTE AMALIE.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ISLAND ABOUT 1.5 MI (2.4 KM) SOUTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE ATOP GRAMBOKOLA HILL. REACHED FROM CHARLOTTE AMALIE GO WEST ON THE MORAVIAN HIGHWAY TO THE AIRPORT ACCESS ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT ON THE AIRPORT ACCESS ROAD AND PROCEED SOUTHWEST FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO A FORK ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH BEARING RIGHT AT ALL FORKS FOR 0.6 MI (1.0 KM) TO A GATE.  PASSAGE THROUGH THE GATE MAY BE COORDINATED THROUGH THE FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINITRATION AT THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ST THOMAS AIRPORT.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND PROCEED UP THE HILL FOR 0.2 MI (0.3 KM) TO THE SECOND ROAD ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND PROCEED UPHILL FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO THE POINT WHERE THE PAVEMENT ENDS THENCE BEAR RIGHT ON A DIM TRACK ROAD UP THE HILL FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION. THE STATION MARK IS A ROTATING AERONAUTICAL BEACON AFFIXED TO A LARGE CUBICAL CONCRETE BASE.  TO THE TOP OF THE ROTATING BEACON IS AFFIXED A PAIR OF RED OBSTRUCTION LIGHTS.  THE BEACON HAS TWO LENSES, ONE WHITE (CLEAR) AND ONE GREEN.  THE BEACON IS LOCATED ABOUT 4000 FT (1219.2 M) SOUTH OF THE END OF RUNWAY 28 AND 5.165 METERS (16.946 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF STATION BRUSH RESET IN AN OUTCROPPING OF ROCK.  THE POINT INTERSECTED IS THE CENTER OF THE ROTATING SHAFT OF THE BEACON.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1993 THIS STATION IS LOCATED AT THE TOP OF GRAMBOKOLA HILL ABOUT 4000 FT (1219.2 M) SOUTH OF RWY END 28.  IT IS A STANDARD BEACON LIGHT, ONE SIDE GREEN, THE OTHER WHITE, MOUNTED DIRECTLY ON A LOW CONCRETE PAD. THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE SHAFT BENEATH THE BEACON LIGHT.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE NORTHEAST PART OF THE CYRIL E. KING AIRPORT IN CHARLOTTE AMALIE, ST THOMAS, USVI. IT IS AT THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CONCRETE GENERAL AVIATION PARKING RAMP.  IT IS 63.52 M (208.40 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FIREHOUSE AND 57.24 M (187.79 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A PAIR OF HANGERS.  IT IS 0.3 M (1.0 FT) IN FROM THE SOUTH AND WEST EDGES OF RAMP.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1993 THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHEAST PART OF THE AIRPORT, IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CONCRETE GENERAL AVIATION PARKING RAMP.  IT IS 208.4 FT (63.5 M) SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FIREHOUSE AND 187.8 FT (57.2 M) SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A PAIR OF HANGARS.  IT IS AN NOS DISK STAMPED STT C 1993 CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE ONE FOOT IN FROM THE SOUTH AND WEST EDGES OF THE RAMP.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE WEST SIDE OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE, ST THOMAS AT THE CYRIL E. KING AIRPORT ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE AIRFIELD ON A CONCRETE APRON/TAXIWAY SOUTHEAST OF THE FIRE AND CRASH STATION NEAR THE WEST SIDE OF THE GENERAL AVIATION RAMP.  REACHED FROM CHARLOTTE AMALIE WEST ON THE MORAVIAN HIGHWAY TO THE AIRPORT ACCESS ROAD, LEFT AND SOUTHWEST ON THE ACCESS ROAD TO THE AIRPORT TERMINAL AND THE AIRPORT MANAGERS OFFICE ON THE SECOND FLOOR OF THE TERMINAL BUILDING WHERE PERMISSION AND CLEARANCE MUST BE OBTAINED TO ENTER THE CONTROLLED AIRCRAFT OPERATIONS AREA.  POINT OF CONTACT FOR AIRFIELD ACCESS IS THE AIRPORT MANAGER, MR. J. CRANSTON WHO MAY BE REACHED AT 809-779-8799 OR 809-774-4081. markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1985 LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ISLAND ABOUT 1 MI (1.6 KM) SOUTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE IN AN AREA KNOWN LOCALLY AS THE SUB BASE AT THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A LARGE CONCRETE PIER OPERATED BY THE VIRGIN ISLANDS PORT AUTHORITY. REACH THE STATION FROM CHARLOTTE AMALIE WESTBOUND ON THE MORAVIAN HIGHWAY FOR 0.5 MI (0.8 KM) TO A FORK ROAD LEFT AT CROWN BAY, TURN LEFT AND PROCEED 0.4 MI (0.6 KM) TO A FORK ROAD LEFT, BEAR LEFT AND PROCEED 0.2 MI (0.3 KM) TO DRIVE LEFT AT A GATE, TURN LEFT PASSING THROUGH THE GATE AND CONTINUE ONTO THE PIER, DRIVE TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PIER TO THE STATION.  THE STATION IS AN NOS BRONZE DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE PIER SURFACE. IT IS 0.41 METERS (1.35 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PIER AND 54.841 METERS (179.924 FT) SOUTH OF SUB RM 1985 AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE PIER.  RESEARCH PERFORMED ON THIS STATION INDICATES THAT IT WAS SET BY A HYDROGRAPHIC FIELD PARTY IN 1985 BUT WAS LATER DEEMED UNNECESSARY FOR HYDROGRAPHIC OPERATIONS AND THUS NEVER POSITIONED SO ALTHOUGH IT IS STAMPED 1985 IS WAS ORIGINALLY POSITIONED IN 1993.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERED 1993 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2006 (DSR) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1955 (JCP) THIS STATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE VIRGIN ISLANDS CADASTRAL SURVEY BY THE PUBLIC WORKS DEPARTMENT.  IT WAS ESTABLISHED TO REPLACE U.S.C. AND G.S. TRIANGULATION STATION PETER.  STATION IS LOCATED ON WHAT IS KNOWN LOCALLY AS ST. PETER MOUNTAIN AND ON THE GROUNDS OF THE MOUNTAIN TOP ESTATES HOTEL OVERLOOKING CHARLOTTE AMALIE.  MARK IS A CADASTRAL SURVEY TRIANGULATION STATION DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE NEAR THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A CONCRETE CISTERN AND STAMPED T 41.  CISTERN PROJECTS ABOUT 4 FEET AND IS ABOUT 250 FEET EAST OF THE EASTERNMOST OF THE HOTEL BUILDINGS.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD I.A.G.S. REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CENTER OF A CONCRETE STANCHION OF AN EAST WEST CONCRETE WALL AND STAMPED PETER R M NO 1 1953.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD I.A.G.S. REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CENTER OF THE END, CORNERLIKE STANCHION OF THE CONCRETE WALL AND STAMPED PETER R M NO 2 1953.                            STATION RECOVERY (1955)  RECOVERY NOTE BY VIRGIN ISLANDS CADASTRAL SURVEY 1955 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (VES) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 HAS BEEN COVERED BY THE CONSTRUCTION OF A BUILDING CURRENTLY IN USE AS A TELEVISION STATION.  A TV TOWER ABOUT 225 FT. HIGH HAS BEEN CONSTRUCTED ON THE PILL BOX CONTAINING THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS IN THE CENTRAL PORTION OF THE ISLAND ABOUT 1 MI (1.6 KM) LINEAR NORTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE AT THE TOP OF A PROMINENT FORMATION KNOWN LOCALLY AS SIGNAL HILL AT THE EDGE OF MOUNTAINTOP ESTATES AT THE SITE OF A FORMER TELEVISION TRANSMITTER WHICH IS NOW GONE AND ADJACENT TO THE CELLULAR ONE ANTENNA.  REACHED FROM CHARLOTTE AMALIE BY PROCEEDING NORTH UP THE HILL ON ANY THROUGH ROAD, HIGHWAYS 35 AND 33 ARE THE PREFERRED ROUTE TO THE VICINITY OF THE MOUNTAINTOP AND THE ACCESS ROAD JUST BELOW THE CREST OF THE HILL.  A FOUR WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE WILL BE REQUIRED TO NEGOTIATE THE FINAL 40 FT (12.2 M) OF THE CLIMB ON A LOOSE ROCK ROAD OR IT MUST BE PACKED.  ABOUT A 5 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION IS BRONZE DISK WITH THE LOGO CADASTRAL SURVEY CAST INTO IT.  THE STAMPING IS DIM BUT READABLE.  IT IS SET IN THE CENTER OF A LARGE CONCRETE CISTERN IN THE TOP.  THE CISTERN HAS HAD LEGS OF TOWERS SET INTO IT AT VARIOUS TIMES BUT AT THE PRESENT HAS NONE IN USE.  THE REFERENCE MARKS AND TELEVISION TRANSMITTER BUILDING REFERRED TO IN THE 1955 DESCRIPTION ARE NO LONGER PRESENT.

THE STATION IS ON A LARGE FLAT-TOPPED ROCK ON THE OUTERMOST PART OF THE POINT.  TO THE E OF THE STATION THE SHORE LINE RECEDES TO FORM TAGUE BAY. STATION DRY IS ALMOST ON RANGE WITH THE HIGHEST PART OF GREEN CAY.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN CREVICE OF THE ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1975 STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR, BUT NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) THE DRILL HOLE AND CEMENT ARE ALL THAT REMAIN OF THE STATION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) THIS STATION IS OFF THE N SHORE OF THE ISLAND OF ST. THOMAS AT THE EASTERN END OF THATCH CAY.  THE SIGNAL IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST HILL OF THATCH CAY.  IT IS A CONICAL SHAPED HILL, AND THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT.  THE TOP OF THE HILL IS SPARSELY WOODED, AND MANY ROCKS ARE IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY OF THE STATION.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 1-INCH COPPER BOLT, CEMENTED IN A SMALL FLAT GRAYISH-COLORED ROCK, RECTANGULAR IN SHAPE ABOUT 2 BY 3 FEET.  THE ROCK PROJECTS ABOUT 1 FOOT ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS THE SAME AS WAS USED BY THE DANES IN THEIR SURVEY OF THE ISLANDS.  A LARGE CORRIDA PLANT IS LOCATED A FEW FEET FROM THE STATION.  A LARGE WHITE HOUSE ON CRUZ BAY ON ST. JOHN ISLAND BEARS 118 DEG (PRISMATIC COMPASS), AND IS IN RANGE WITH THE LARGER OF THE BROTHERS ISLANDS.  HIGHEST PEAK OF LITTLE TOBAGO BEARS 6 DEG (PRISMATIC COMPASS).  TWO STANDARD REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED NEARBY.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS CEMENTED IN A CREVICE OF A LARGE ROCK, AND IS IN AZIMUTH 100 DEG (PRISMATIC COMPASS), 2.75 METERS DISTANT FROM STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS CEMENTED IN A CREVICE OF BEDROCK, AND IS IN AZIMUTH 182 DEG (PRISMATIC COMPASS), 2.95 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION WAS NOT SEARCHED FOR.  TOP OF HILL USED FOR A SIGNAL ON OFF-SHORE HYDROGRAPHY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM NOS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN FAIR CONDITION.  BOTH RMS HAVE BEEN TAMPERED WITH.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1991 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS NEAR THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND ALONG THE SHORE OF AND AT THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CITY OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE IN THE VICINITY OF HAVENSIGHT POINT ON THE WEST INDIAN COMPANY DOCKS (CRUISE SHIPS) ON THE EASTERN PART OF THE DOCK ABOUT 180 METERS (590.5 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE HEAD OF THE DOCK AND ABOUT 650 METERS (2132.5 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE SEAWARD END OF THE PIER ON THE SEAWALL.  REACH FROM CHARLOTTE AMALIE BY TRAVELLING EAST ON VETERANS DRIVE (HIGHWAY 30) TO THE HAVENSIGHT MALL AT THE EAST EDGE OF TOWN, TURN RIGHT INTO THE HAVENSIGHT MALL COMPLEX AND HEAD NORTHWEST TO THE DOCK THENCE NORTHEAST TO THE STATION ON THE SEAWALL AT A POINT NEARLY ON LINE BETWEEN TWO WAREHOUSES.  THE STATION MARK IS AN NOS BRONZE BENCH MARK DISK CEMENTED INTO A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE SURFACE OF THE BULKHEAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2006 (DSR) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 (WEL) UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS, ISLAND AND COUNTY OF SAINT THOMAS, SOUTH CENTRAL SAINT THOMAS IN THE PORT CITY OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.  TO REACH THE TIDAL BENCH MARK FROM THE CYRIL E KING (AKA HARRY S TRUMAN) AIRPORT, TAKE AIRPORT ROAD EASTERLY TO HIGHWAY 30, TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED ON HIGHWAY 30 EASTERLY TO CHARLOTTE AMALIE FROM THE U.S. COAST GUARD DOCK AT KINGS WHARF AND THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 30 AND PORT PLADSON, CONTINUE 1.26 MI (2.0 KM) EASTERLY ALONG HIGHWAY 30 TO HAVE SIGHT YACHT HAVEN.  TURN RIGHT, SOUTH FOR APPROXIMATELY 0.12 MI (0.23 KM) TO MARK NORTHWEST OF THE PORT AUTHORITY BUILDING.  THE TIDAL MARK IS A DISK SET FLUSH IN THE NORTHWEST FACE OF THE CONCRETE BULKHEAD ON THE WEST INDIES DOCK NEAR THE WEST INDIES CRUISE SHIP COMPANY AND PORT AUTHORITY BUILDING, 16.79 M (55.1 FT) NORTHWEST OF A CINDER BLOCK FLOWER BOX WHICH RUNS SOUTHEAST-NORTHWEST ALONG SIDE A WALKWAY THAT TERMINATES INTO A CYCLONE FENCE GATE THAT ALLOWS ACCESS TO DOCK AND MARK BEYOND, 8.23 M (27.0 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF TWO BITTS, 7.92 M (26.0FT) NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF TWO BITTS, 0.3 M (1 FT) FROM THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE PIER NEXT TO TWO ACCESS HATCHES BUILT FLUSH WITH THE DOCK'S SURFACE.  NO PUBLIC ACCESS.  THE DOCK IS FENCED OFF.  ACCESS MUST BE OBTAINED FROM DOCK SECURITY. V4613
