markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS SITUATED ON THE SECOND FROM THE SW END OF BIG TOBAGO ISLAND OF THE FOUR HILLS ON TOBAGO ISLAND.  CENTER OF STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A CRACK IN A LARGE FLAT ROCK LYING BETWEEN TWO OTHER ROCKS, ONE OF WHICH RESTS ON IT.  IT IS SLIGHTLY ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE RIDGE AND ABOUT THE MIDDLE OF THE TOP OF THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK IS A REGULATION BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER ON THE TOP OF THE RIDGE.  IT BEARS S 20 DEG 20 MIN W (TRUE) AND IS 7.42 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2019)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2019 (OKC) MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) ON AN EVENLY SLOPING ROUNDED POINT, REGIS POINT.  THE STATION MARK IS ABOUT 10 METERS BACK FROM THE HIGH WATER MARK.  STANDARD DISK LOCATED ON ABOUT A 45 DEG SLOPING ROCKY POINT W OF LITTLE KRUM BAY, AND OVERLOOKING WEST GREGORIE CHANNEL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) NO PHYSICAL RECOVERY WAS MADE.  TOP OF CAY USED FOR SIGNAL.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS SITUATED ON THE PROMINENT POINT ON THE N SIDE OF TURNERS BAY.  IT IS ON THE MAIN PART OF THE POINT.  THERE IS A ROCKY LEDGE OUTSIDE OF THE STATION WHICH IS SEPARATED FROM IT AT HIGH TIDE.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED INTO A DEPRESSION OF THE BARE ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A REGULATION BRASS REFERENCE MARK CEMENTED INTO A DEPRESSION IN THE TOP OF A LARGE BOULDER LYING AGAINST THE SIDE OF THE POINT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION FOUND AS DESCIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (JGC) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD, UNSTAMPED BRASS DISK.  REFERENCE MARK FOUND AS DESCRIBED IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1924 (GCM) STATION IS DESCRIBED IN BUOY LIST, 1925, U.S. LIGHTHOUSE SERVICE, PAGE 19.  MAIN CHANNEL CHRISTIANSTED HARBOR.  ENTRANCE REAR RANGE BEACON ON AXIS OF CHANNEL BETWEEN GREAT MIDDLE GROUND AND SCOTCH BANK.  STRUCTURE IS 20 FEET HIGH, 800 YARDS FROM FRONT BEACON 164 DEG FROM SAME.  TWO WHITE TRIANGULAR DAYMARKS, APEX TO APEX, ON PYRAMIDAL CONCRETE BASE.  STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/2 MILE S OF FORT LOUISA LIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (KWJ) STATION IS LOCATED ON NORTH COAST OF ST. CROIX ISLAND, VIRGIN ISLANDS, APPROXIMATELY 5 MILES NORTHWEST OF CHRISTIANSTED. STATION IS ON GRASS COVERED RIDGE 200 METERS WSW OF LA VALLEE ESTATE CHIMNEY AND MILLS.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 125 METERS SOUTH OF TOP OS NORTH END OF RIDGE ON HIGHEST CREST OF RIDGE.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK STAMPED VALLEE 2 1967 CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN SMALL ROCK ON RIDGE.  RUST ON TWIST MILL SHOWS MIDWAY BETWEEN LA VALLEE CHIMNEY AND LA VALLEE LARGE MILL.  THIS STATION IS R.M. 2 OF THE ORIGINAL STATION VALLEE 1919 WHICH WAS NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A CRACK ON TOP OF RIDGE.  THE HILL AT BARONS BLUFF AND LA VALLEE HOUSE ARE ON RANGE.  ANGLES WERE NOT TURNED TO R.M. 3.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON GRASS COVERED RIDGE 200 METERS W OF LA VALLEE ESTATE CHIMNEY AND MILLS.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 50 METERS S OF TOP OF N END OF RIDGE AND 3 METERS W OF MIDDLE OF RIDGE.  TOP OF BARONS BLUFF IS ON RANGE WITH THE SMALLER OF THE TWO LA VALLEE MILLS.  CLAREMONT MILL AND S TANGENT OF THE LARGE LA VALLEE MILL ARE ON RANGE.  BODKIN MILL AND NORTH STAR MILL ARE ON RANGE.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN CRACK OF 0.4-METER DIAMETER ROCK, OUTCROPPING 0.2 METER.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN SMALL ROCK ON E SIDE OF TOP OF THE RIDGE.  CLAREMONT MILL AND LA VALLEE ESTATE HOUSE ARE ON RANGE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A SIMILAR DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN SMALL ROCK ON THE RIDGE.  RUST ON TWIST MILL SHOWS MIDWAY BETWEEN LA VALLEE CHIMNEY AND LA VALLEE LARGE MILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN CRACK ON TOP OF RIDGE.  TOP OF HILL AT BARONS BLUFF AND LA VALLEE HOUSE ARE ON RANGE.  TOP OF POLE - 2.5 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION WAS NOT VISITED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (KWJ) STATION AND R.M. NO. 1 COULD NOT BE FOUND AND ARE BELIEVED DESTROYED.  R.M. 2 AND R.M. 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. 2 WAS OCCUPIED AND ESTABLISHED AS A NEW STATION.  IT WAS STAMPED VALLEE 2 1967.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--5 MILES NORTHWEST OF CHRISTIANSTED, ST. CROIX.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (RHH) REFERENCE MARK 3 AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. REFERENCE MARK 2 HAS BEEN RESTAMPED VALLEY 2 1976, NO DESCRIPTION WAS FOUND FOR THIS. THE DRILL HOLE WAS FOUND FOR THE STATION BUT THE DISK HAD BEEN REMOVED. THIS WAS CONFIRMED BY MEASURMENTS TO THE REFERENCE MARKS.  THERE ARE TWO WAYS OF REACHING THE STATION. GO TO A WHITE HOUSE (OWNER MR. ISLES) ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF NORTH SHORE ROAD 0.1 KM (0.05 MI) EAST OF THE CANE BAY REEF CLUB AND PACK EAST UPHILL TO STATION ON RIDGE NEAR POWER POLE. OR, AT THE LA VALLEE STORE GO WEST THEN NORTH THROUGH THE LA VALLEE RUINS AND PICK WAY UPHILL TO A FENCE AND ETT. (A 4 WHEEL DRIVE JEEP IS REQUIRED FOR THIS ROUTE) THENCE PACK WEST AND SOUTH TO STATION WHERE POWER LINE CROSSES RIDGE.  A NEW DISK STAMPED---VALLEE 1919 RESET 1980---, WAS CEMENTED IN THE EXISTING DRILL HOLE. IT IS LOCATED 6.0 METERS (19.7 FT) SOUTH OF A POWER POLE ON TOP OF A RIDGE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.5 METERS                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1980. THE ROUTE TO THE STATION BY MR. ISLES HOUSE CAN BE DRIVEN WITH 4 WHEEL DRIVE. WITH MR. ISLES PERMISSION YOU CAN ENTER THE PASTURE AT A GATE JUST NORTH OF THE HOUSE AND GO SOUTH TO TOP OF RIDGE THENCE NORTH ALONG RIDGE TO STATION.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS TOP OF TOWER (CONCRETE) RECTANGULAR SHAPE WITH PYRAMIDAL CAP.  MONUMENT IS LOCATED SW OF THE HOUSES ON MAFFOLI ESTATE AND OVERLOOKS THE TOWN OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.  THIS MARKS THE PASSAGE OF VENUS IN 1882.  THE MONUMENT IS 40 INCHES BY 66 INCHES AND 13.5 FEET HIGH.  THERE IS A NUMBER OF FOUNDATION PILLARS IN THE VICINITY WHICH ARE IN GOOD CONDITION, BUILT IN VARYING SHAPES.  THE ELEVATION AS DETERMINED BY TOPOGRAPHY OF THE TOP OF TOWER IS 807 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION IS IN PLACE.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 THE MARK IS LOCATED ON THE CAMPUS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS.OWNERSHIP--THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS.   TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HWY.66 AND 70 AT THE SUNNY ISLE SHOPPING CENTER, TRAVEL WEST ALONG HWY.70 FOR 3.88 MI (6.2 KM) TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE UNIVERSITY ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT, TRAVEL SOUTH FOR.88 MI (1.4 KM) TO THE BOOK STORE AND CAFETERIA BUILDING, TRAVEL EAST FOR 350 FT (106.7 M) TO ROAD, CONTINUE SOUTH ALONG ROAD FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT.  THE MARK IS A VERTICAL CONTROL DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CISTERN RETAINING WALL.   THE MARK IS 42.8 M (140.4 FT) SOUTHWEST OF LIGHT POLE, 24 M (78.7 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF LIGHT POLE, 14.0 M (45.9 FT) NORTHEAST FROM THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF STEEL GRATE, AND 7.0 M (23.0 FT) SOUTHEAST OF A FIRE HYDRANT.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN A MASSIVE RETAINING WALL
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 THE MARK IS LOCATED ON THE CAMPUS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS, ST CROIX.  OWNERSHIP-- UNIVERSITY OF VIRGIN ISLANDS.   TO REACH THE MARK FROM THE HWY.70 AND 66 AT THE SUNNY ISLE SHOPPING CENTER, TRAVEL EAST ON HWY.70 FOR 3.88 MI (6.2 KM) TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND TRAVEL SOUTH FOR 0.28 MI (0.5 KM) TO BOOK STORE AND CAFETERIA BUILDING, TURN LEFT AND GO 350 FT (106.7 M) TO A ROAD ON RIGHT, FOLLOW ROAD EAST THEN SOUTH FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) BEHIND BUILDING AND THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.   THE MARK IS A STANDARD NGS VERTICAL DISK SET IN THE CISTERN CONCRETE BASE.THE MARK IS 18.6 M (61.0 FT) SOUTHWEST OF A LIGHT POLE, 12.5 M (41.0 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTH-SOUTH ROAD CENTERLINE, 20.1 M (65.9 FT) NORTHWEST OF A LIGHT POLE, 11.5 M (37.7 FT) EAST OF A LIGHT POLE, AND 0.2 M (0.7 FT) ABOVE THE ROAD LEVEL.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS, ISLAND AND COUNTY OF SAINT THOMAS, SOUTH CENTRAL SAINT THOMAS IN THE PORT CITY OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE ON THE CAMPUS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS.   STARTING FROM THE UNITED STATES COAST GUARD STATION IN CHARLOTTE AMALIE, AT THE INTERSECTION OF PORT PLADSON AND HIGHWAY 30, GO 2.5 MI (4.0 KM) WESTERLY ALONG HIGHWAY 30 TO THE CYRIL E.KING AIRPORT FIRE STATION ON THE LEFT, AND TAKE THE BACK CAMPUS ROAD RIGHT GOING 0.34 MI (0.5 KM) TO A ROAD LEFT LEADING TO THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLAND'S BUSINESS AND FINANCE OFFICE, THENCE TURN LEFT AND GO 250 FT (76.2 M) TO THE PARKING AREA ON THE RIGHT.   SET IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A 1.5 M (4.9 FT) BY 4.3 M (14.1 FT) BY 1.6 M (5.2 FT) HIGH AREA OF OUTCROPPING BEDROCK, 24.2 M (79.4 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A UTILITY POLE, 17.3 M (56.8 FT) EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE UVI BUSINESS OFFICE BUILDING, 9.8 M (32.2 FT) NORTHWEST OF A UTILITY POLE, 7.6 M (24.9 FT) EAST OF A CACTUS TREE AND 1.4 M (4.6 FT) ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE AND DRIVEWAY.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS, ISLAND AND COUNTY OF SAINT THOMAS, SOUTH CENTRAL SAINT THOMAS IN THE PORT CITY OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE ON THE CAMPUS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS.   STARTING FROM THE UNITED STATES COAST GUARD STATION IN CHARLOTTE AMALIE, AT THE INTERSECTION OF PORT PLADSON AND HIGHWAY 30, GO 2.5 MI (4.0 KM) WESTERLY ALONG HIGHWAY 30 TO THE CYRIL E.KING AIRPORT FIRE STATION ON THE LEFT, AND TAKE THE BACK CAMPUS ROAD RIGHT GOING 0.34 MI (0.5 KM) TO A ROAD LEFT LEADING TO THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLAND'S BUSINESS AND FINANCE OFFICE, THENCE TURN LEFT AND GO 250 FT (76.2 M) TO THE PARKING AREA ON THE RIGHT.   SET IN A 1 FT (0.3 M) BY 2 FT (0.6 M) BY 1.75 FT (0.5 M) HIGH OUTCROP THAT IS 22.1 M (72.5 FT) SOUTHEAST OF AN UTILITY POLE, 14.6 M (47.9 FT) WEST OF A UTILITY POLE, 9.4 M (30.8 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE UNIVERSITY OF THE VIRGIN ISLAND'S BUSINESS OFFICE BUILDING, 6.2 M (20.3 FT) SOUTH OF A CACTUS TREE, 0.4 M (1.3 FT) ABOVE THE LEVEL OF THE DRIVEWAY.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) ON HIGHEST PART OF MT. WASHINGTON, WHICH IS THE HIGH GRASS-COVERED HILL RISING E OF BUTLERS BAY, ON W SHORE OF ST. CROIX, S SIDE OF HILL IS VERY STEEP, SLOPING DOWN TO THE CREQUE ROAD.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION OF OUTCROPPING ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS REFERENCE DISK CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION OF LEDGE OUTCROPPING 1 BY 5 METERS ON SOUTHERN EDGE OF HILLTOP.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A SIMILAR MARK CEMENTED IN CRACK IN OUTCROPPING ROCK ON WESTERN EDGE OF HILLTOP.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A DRILL HOLE IN A DEPRESSION OF THE OUTCROPPING LEDGE FORMING THE SE BREAK OF THE HILLTOP.  TOP OF POLE - 4.24 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK 1 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3 HAD BEEN DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARK 4 WAS SET AT THIS TIME.  THE STATION MARK WAS USED AS THE ANTENNA SITE FOR GEOCEIVER STATION 51195.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES NORTH OF FREDERIKSTED, ABOUT 1 MILE EAST OF BUTLER BAY AND ON THE HIGHEST PART OF MT. WASHINGTON. IT IS ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. EMILE TRANBERG, WHO LIVES ABOUT 0.25 MILE EAST OF THE STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SPRAT HALL HOTEL, WHICH IS 2 MILES NORTH OF FREDERIKSTED, GO NORTHEAST ON MAIN PAVED ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD AND TOW STONE PILLARS ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON GRAVELLED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHEASTERLY AND UPHILL FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT FORK AND GO UPHILL ON GRAVELLED ROAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO A FORK. TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ON BLADED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP SHARP RIGHT FORK AND GO WESTERLY FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FENCELINE AND NEAR SUMMIT OF THE HILL.  FROM HERE PACK ACROSS FENCELINE, SOUTHERLY FOR 150 FEET TO HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, NOT STAMPED, CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION IN OUTCROPPING ROCK WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 1 FOOT.  IT IS ABOUT 160 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF A BLADED ROAD AND ABOUT 60 FEET SOUTH OF AN EAST/WEST FENCELINE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, NOT STAMPED, CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION IN OUTCROPPING ROCK LEDGE ON THE SOUTHWEST BREAK OF THE HILL.  IT IS 175 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE FENCELINE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WASHINGTON 1919 NO 4 1977, CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION IN ROCK OUTCROP ON THE EAST BREAK OF THE HILL.  IT IS 102 FEET SOUTH OF THE FENCELINE AND 25 FEET EAST OF A DIM TRACK ROAD.  ABOUT 1.5 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 3 MILES NORTH OF FREDERIKSTED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1980 (THH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION DUE TO CHANGES IN THE AREA, A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS.  TO REACH FROM THE MUNICIPAL PIER IN FREDERIKSTED, GO EAST FOR 1 BLOCK TO A CROSSROAD, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON MAIN ROAD FOR 3.5 KM (2.2 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT JUST BEFORE REACHING A SHARP S CURVE WITH CONCRETE RETAINING WALL. TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON GRAVEL ROAD FOR 1.4 KM (0.85 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD EAST FOR 0.3 KM (0.8 MI) TO A REVERSE FORK RIGHT, LEADING TO A HOUSE (PROPERTY OWNERS HOUSE, HE SHOULD BE CONTACTED BEFORE GOING ON TO STATION), CONTINUE AHEAD, EAST THEN NORTH THEN WEST AND BACK EAST (GOING AROUND END OF A VALLEY) FOR 0.6KM (0.4 MI) TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION IN OPEN GRASSY AREA ON RIGHT. THIS STATION HAS GROUND TO GROUND VISIBILITY FROM FREDERIKSTED SOUTH COVERING ALL OF SOUTHWEST CAPE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1980.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS NEAR THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND ON WATER ISLAND NEAR THE CENTER OF WATER ISLAND.  THE OBJECT IS A TAN COLORED ENCLOSED TOWER SEVERAL STORIES IN HEIGHT ABOVE THE TREE LINE.  THE POINT INTERSECTED IS THE CENTER OF THE STRUCTURE.
DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) USED FOR HYDROGRAPHIC PURPOSES.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) THIS INTERSECTION STATION, IS ON THE WESTERN END OF THATCH CAY.  IT IS ABOUT 15 METERS FROM THE OUTER END OF THE ROCKY POINT AND ABOUT ON THE CENTER LINE OF THE LEDGE.  THIS PART OF THE POINT IS SEPARATED FROM THE REST OF THE POINT BY A NARROW CHASM, THUS MAKING THE STATION ON A DETACHED ROCK.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED INTO A DEPRESSION OF THE ROCK.  PETER IS 7,283.8 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION, IN AZIMUTH 84 DEG 23 MIN 30 SEC, AND LOLLIK IS 5,281.0 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION, IN AZIMUTH 141 DEG 41 MIN 57 SEC.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS NEAR THE SOUTH CENTRAL PORTION OF THE ISLAND ABOUT 0.5 MI (0.8 KM) SOUTHWEST OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE NEAR THE SOUTHERN POINT OF CONFLUENCE OF EAST AND WEST GREGERIE CHANNELS JUST OFFSHORE AND NORTH-NORTHWEST OF SANDY POINT OF WATER ISLAND.  THE OBJECT IS A NAVIGATIONAL LIGHT MOUNTED ON A THREE PILE DOLPHIN WITH A TRIANGULAR RED DAYBOARD BEARING THE NUMBER 6.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE LIGHT.  THIS IS LIGHT NUMBER 27515 IN THE 1993 EDITION OF THE U.S.C.G. LIGHT LIST VOLUME III.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS IN THE SOUTH CENTRAL PART OF THE ISLAND ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE AT HAVENSIGHT POINT AT THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A PIER EXTENSION OF THE WEST INDIAN COMPANY DOCK WHICH IS USED BY CRUISE SHIPS.  THE OBJECT IS A RED NAVIGATIONAL LIGHT MOUNTED ON A 10 CM DIAMETER STEEL LIGHT STANDARD WHICH IS LAG BOLTED TO THE CONCRETE SURFACE OF THE PIER.  THE POINT INTERSECTED WAS THE CENTER OF THE LIGHT.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ST THOMAS ISLAND IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS ON THE SOUTH CENTRAL PORTION OF THE ISLAND ALONG THE SHORE IN THE CITY OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE AT THE WESTERN END OF THE HISTORICAL KINGS WHARF WHICH IS CURRENTLY BEING USED AS A DOCK BY THE U.S. COAST GUARD.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED FROM THE ST THOMAS AIRPORT BY TRAVELLING EAST AND NORTHEAST ON THE AIRPORT ACCESS ROAD FROM THE TERMINAL BUILDING FOR 0.5 MI (0.8 KM) TO THE T INTERSECTION AT THE MORAVIAN HIGHWAY (HIGHWAY 30), TURN RIGHT ON THE MORAVIAN HIGHWAY AND PROCEED EAST FOR 2.0 MI (3.2 KM) (MORAVIAN HIGHWAY BECOMES VETERANS DRIVE AT THE CHARLOTTE AMALIE CITY LIMITS) TO THE COAST GUARD STATION ON THE RIGHT JUST BEFORE FORT CHRISTIAN, TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED SOUTH FOR 0.05 MI (0.08 KM) TO A GATE, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND TURN RIGHT ONTO THE PIER AND PROCEED TO THE END OF THE CONCRETE SECTION OF THE PIER AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS AN NOS BRONZE DISK CEMENTED INTO A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE SURFACE OF THE PIER, IT IS, 23.3 FT (7.1 M) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF A 10 CM DIAMETER IRON PIER LIGHT STANDARD, 13.43 FT (4.09 M) SOUTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE PIER, 12.27 FT (3.74 M) NORTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE PIER AND 2.78 FT (0.85 M) EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE PIER.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 (WEL) UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS, ISLAND AND COUNTY OF SAINT THOMAS, SOUTH CENTRAL SAINT THOMAS IN THE PORT CITY OF CHARLOTTE AMALIE.   TO REACH THE TIDAL BENCH MARK FROM THE CYRIL E KING (AKA HARRY S TRUMAN) AIRPORT IN CHARLOTTE AMALIE, TAKE AIRPORT ROAD EASTERLY TO HIGHWAY 30, TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED ON HIGHWAY 30 EASTERLY APPROXIMATELY 2.5 MI (4.0 KM) TO THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 30 AND PORT PLADSON, AT THE ENTRANCE OF THE UNITED STATES COAST GUARD DOCK AT KINGS WHARF GO TO THE THE END OF THE EAST-WEST PIER ON THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF THE FACILITY,   290 FT (88.4 M) WEST OF THE ENTRANCE GATE, 2.53 M (8.3 FT) NORTH OF STATION 975 1639 NO 1 TIDAL, 4.1 M (3.3 FT) SOUTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE PIER, 3.7 M (12.1 FT) NORTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE PIER, 0.85 M (2.8 FT) EAST OF THE END OF THE PIER.   NO PUBLIC ACCESS.  THE DOCK IS FENCED OFF. ACCESS MUST BE OBTAINED FROM THE UNITED STATES COAST GUARD.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN A MASSIVE RETAINING WALL
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE WESTERN END OF WHISTLING CAY N SIDE OF ST. JOHN.  THE STATION IS NOT FAR ABOVE THE WATERLINE.  IT IS ON THE FIRST POINT SE OF THE SHARP EXTREME WESTERN TIP OF THE CAY.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION STATION MARK CEMENTED IN THE ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR FUTURE RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2022)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2022 (RH) MARK NOT FOUND.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1919 (OWS) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST OF THE SALT RIVER HILLS.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 5 METERS S OF AND 2 FEET LOWER THAN THE HIGHEST TIP OF THE HILL.  THE HILLTOP IS COVERED WITH LOW TREES.  AN 8-FOOT SCAFFOLD WAS BUILT OVER THE STATION.  MARKED BY A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE OF AN 0.7 METER DIAMETER BOULDER PROJECTING 0.6 METER.  TOP OF BUCK ISLAND AND SMALL HILL JUST E OF JUDAS FANCY CHIMNEY ARE ON RANGE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE MIDDLE GROUP OF BOULDERS LYING ON W EDGE OF RIDGE RUNNING S FROM THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD DISK IN A DRILL HOLE IN AN 0.3 BY 0.4 METER LONE BOULDER LYING 3 METERS W OF TOP OF HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A SIMILAR DISK IN A DRILL HOLE IN TOP OF BOULDER LYING 3 METERS N OF HILLTOP AND PROJECTING 0.2 METER.
